intro: Edraianthus wettsteinii subsp. lovcenicus, commonly known as the Lovcenian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in alpine and subalpine regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
